seo.title: Resources | SustainSage
seo.description: Coaching-informed worksheets, prompts, and playlists from SustainSage. Use them gently and adapt them with consent to your own context.

hero.title: Tools for reflection at your own pace
hero.subtitle: Curated bilingual resources to support your experiments between sessions. No email gate, no pressure—just invitations to pause and notice.

featured.title: Featured tools
featured.intro: Each resource is grounded in ICF-aligned coaching principles and designed to be adapted to your reality.

tools.title: Values and anchors worksheet
tools.summary: A guided reflection to map what steadies you when navigating unfamiliar workplaces.

tools.title: Micro-experiment planner
tools.summary: Design low-risk tests with clear consent, support, and measures of learning.

tools.title: Culture bridge checklist
tools.summary: Questions to translate expectations between UK norms and Chinese cultural wisdom without losing yourself.

tools.title: Coaching conversation starters
tools.summary: Prompts to invite reflective dialogue with peers, mentors, or community partners.

tools.title: Grounding audio for in-between moments
tools.summary: Short bilingual practices to help you reset before or after courageous conversations.

tools.title: Learning review journal
tools.summary: A light-touch journal to capture insights after experiments and plan the next step.

disclaimer.title: Use with care
disclaimer.body: These tools complement coaching conversations; they do not replace therapy, legal, immigration, medical, or financial advice. Adapt them kindly and pause if something feels overwhelming.
points: You choose what to complete and what to skip—there is no homework requirement.
Respect confidentiality when working with others and only share what you have consent to share.
If strong emotions surface, reach out to trusted support or professional services in your region.

cta.title: Want a guided walkthrough?
cta.body: Book a chemistry chat to explore how these tools can support your goals, or ask for a custom resource for your team.
